abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mekong Health Support
            Project for Vietnam were as follows: overall outcome was
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            and both the Bank and the Borrower performance were
            satisfactory. The important project lessons learned are: (i)
            the technical lessons learned of relevance for the World
            Bank and other countries work on universal health care; and
            (ii) the particular project design and implementation issues
            which have implications for the design of such projects.
